spoken_words: and i will miss you but now i must go

can not

hey monsieur aidez-moi ces deux types chez qui jhabite me fait travailler jour et nuit ils ne me donnent pas a manger ils me fait dormir sur la terre ils mettent dantigel dans le vin et ils sont donne mon chapeau rouge a lane

ah maurice once the american boy gets here your days of endless back-breaking labor will be over

welcome to your new home escape is impossible my name is cesar this is my nephew ugolin you may find life here at the chateau hard but if you shut up and do exactly what we say the time will pass more quickly
these wont fit us but we can sell them
hurry up boy my grapes are waiting for their water
yes pass me the wine
quiet when you work like a man we will feed you like one
you leave maurice alone the floor is good enough for you you go to sleep there
now watch me you grab the grape between your thumb and forefinger and gently twist it off and drop it in the bucket
now you do it
very good now do it a million times
silence
this will be our finest vintage ever

whenever i find my faith in a higher power shaken i always think of the miracle of anti-freeze too much can be poison but the right amount gives wine just the right kick mais dans les proportions voulues ca donne du corps au vin
kill someone dont be ridiculous

drink this

drink it

you mean all white with pink eyes
he makes me crazy twelve months a year at least you get the summer off

be good

oh shes just jealous shell get over it and if she doesnt we can always exchange her
just kidding

well

and the national flag is a two-headed eagle on a red field

im defending a country where people can think and act and worship any way they want

yes bart

yes yes

everyone here in the united states is fine we think maggie may say her first word any day now lisa got an a in math which im only mentioning as news -- im not putting you down and your father well last night he went to sleep talking about how much he loves you
remember to dress warm and try to be as helpful as you can to your adopted parents
hello homer whats that
oh my

wow a cherry bomb

so youre gonna flush it
people people no rough-housing on the monkey bars you there tuck in your shirt watch it i saw that

morning boys

mmm-hmm
simpson lets move on now mother shall we
okay mother this way
now hold it right there you
mother
hello mrs simpson im afraid theres been a very disturbing incident at school today
mmm-hmm i understand completely the disturbing incident i was referring to happened this morning when your son flushed an explosive device down the boys lavatory
unfortunately at the same moment my mother was in the girls lavatory making use of the facilities
mr and mrs simpson we have transcended incorrigible i dont think suspension or expulsion will do the trick i think it behooves us all to consider deportation

well perhaps i was being a tad glib let me explain our elementary school participates in a foreign exchange program now normally a student is selected on the basis of academic excellence or intelligence but in barts case im prepared to make a big exception and if youre willing to play along he can spend the next three months studying far far away
actually hed be staying in france in a lovely chateau in the heart of the wine country
oh when hes totally immersed in a foreign language the average child can become fluent in weeks
im sure hell pick up enough to get by and the whole thing wont cost you a dime as long youre willing to take in a student of your own
well for one thing you wouldnt be getting a french boy you would be getting an albanian
no no no no a student from albania its a country on the adriatic sea
mmm-hmm
way to go

you may find his accent peculiar certain aspects of his culture may seem absurd perhaps even offensive but i urge you all to give little adil the benefit of the doubt in this way and only in this way can we hope to better understand our backward neighbors throughout the world
okay kid lets go
hes right you know
cesar look we are rich
